raw_response: {"answer_index": 0, "answer_text": "Sofosbuvir and simeprevir", "confidence": 9, "reasoning": "This patient has chronic hepatitis C infection (positive HCV IgG and high HCV RNA) and no evidence of acute or chronic hepatitis B infection. The current standard of care for chronic hepatitis C is direct-acting antiviral agents such as sofosbuvir and simeprevir. Interferon-gamma is not used for hepatitis C; ribavirin is rarely used alone and is typically combined with direct-acting antivirals in select cases; lamivudine is used for hepatitis B, not C.", "evidence_quality": "normal"}
